newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany barley harvest starts amid ideal weather.
newsitem.headline: Germany barley harvest starts amid ideal weather.

text.p: Barley harvesting has begun in southwest Germany in sunny and dry weather, the meteorological office DWD reported.
"The weather is dry enough for the barley harvest while soil moisture and temperatures in the other crop areas are also fine, which means the grain crop is maturing well," a DWD source said.
Barley harvesting will be followed by winter rye and wheat, then spring grains.
Maize and sugar beet were also receiving plenty of sun and water, DWD reported.
Rapeseed crops, which will be harvested from end-July, were also developing normally.
Farmers were cutting silage as the rainy patterns seen in June receded.
DWD forecast sporadic rains and temperatures of up to 26 degrees over the next seven days.
Farm union DBV said it plans its first national harvest progress report around July 23.
